question.title: Conditional on the EU's GDP growth rate exceeding 4% in any year from 2024 to 2028, will Japan's GDP growth rate exceed 3% in any year from 2025 to 2027?
question.body:
This question explores the potential correlation between the economic growth of the European Union and Japan. 

Suppose the following is true: The GDP growth rate of the European Union, as reported by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF), exceeds 4% for any calendar year between 2024 and 2028. The growth rate must be based on official annual GDP growth data.

Then, is the following also true? Japan's annual GDP growth rate exceeds 3% in any calendar year from January 1, 2025, to December 31, 2027. The GDP growth rate will be determined based on official data released by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF).

Resolution criteria: If the condition is met (EU's GDP growth exceeding 4%), the question resolves 'Yes' if Japan's GDP growth exceeds 3% in the specified period, and 'No' otherwise. If the condition is not met, the question resolves 'N/A'.

para_P.title: If the GDP growth rate of the EU surpasses 4% in any year between 2024 and 2028, will Japan's GDP growth rate be greater than 3% in any year from 2025 to 2027?

The process must be verified by independent experts and reported in reputable scientific journals. Commercial implementation means that the process is being used in at least one large-scale industrial application. (2) India officially implements a universal basic income (UBI) policy. The policy must be enacted by the Indian government and officially published in the government's legal records. (3) Brazil holds a national referendum specifically on constitutional amendments. The referendum must be officially recognized by the Brazilian government and the results must be published in the country's official records.

para_P.title: Will the following events take place before January 1, 2028: (1) A new chemical method for large-scale carbon capture is effectively created and put into commercial use, (2) India adopts a universal basic income scheme, and (3) Brazil conducts a national vote on constitutional changes?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered 'Yes' if the following criteria are fulfilled between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (1) A novel chemical method for large-scale carbon capture is effectively created and put into commercial use. The method must be validated by independent authorities and documented in credible scientific publications. Commercial use means that the method is applied in at least one significant industrial operation. (2) India formally adopts a universal basic income (UBI) scheme. The scheme must be enacted by the Indian authorities and officially recorded in the government's legal documentation. (3) Brazil conducts a national vote specifically regarding constitutional changes. The vote must be officially acknowledged by the Brazilian authorities, and the outcomes must be published in the nation's official documentation.

question.title: Conditional on both a major Canadian political party including environmental science policies as a key platform in the 2027 federal election and the US Supreme Court ruling on a case involving the entertainment industry before January 1, 2028, will the percentage of Americans who believe in climate change denial fall below 10% before January 1, 2028?

This means that the platform is officially published and recognized by reputable news sources between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. (b) The US Supreme Court issues a ruling on a case involving the entertainment industry at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, and this ruling is documented in the official records of the Supreme Court.

Given these conditions, will the percentage of Americans who believe in climate change denial fall below 10% before January 1, 2028? This will be resolved as 'Yes' if the percentage falls below 10% based on reputable public opinion polls conducted by organizations such as Gallup, Pew Research Center, or similar institutions, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

para_P.title: If both a candidate pledges to support funding for microbiology research and Russia cuts its emissions by 15%, will the US face a government shutdown lasting 30 days prior to 2028?

Imagine the following happens before the start of 2028: (a) Any candidate participating in a national election openly promises to provide funding for microbiology research, with this promise being documented and covered by credible news outlets. (b) Russia's yearly greenhouse gas emissions drop by no less than 15% compared to the levels of 2024, as verified by a trusted environmental monitoring organization.

Under these circumstances, will the United States undergo a federal government shutdown that lasts for at least 30 consecutive days between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The length of the shutdown will be ascertained through official government records and announcements.

question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following conditions are met before January 1, 2028: (a) Any candidate in a national election campaign publicly commits to funding microbiology research. (b) Russia's annual greenhouse gas emissions, as reported by a reputable environmental monitoring agency such as the Russian Federal State Statistics Service or the International Energy Agency, decrease by at least 15% compared to 2024 levels between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028. (c) The United States experiences a federal government shutdown lasting at least 30 consecutive days. The duration of the shutdown will be determined based on official government records and announcements, between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028.

question.title: Given Switzerland holds a national referendum on joining the EU before 2028, will the percentage of Americans who believe in climate change denial fall below 10% before 2028?

Outcome: The percentage of Americans who believe in climate change denial must fall below 10% between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, based on reputable public opinion polls from organizations like Gallup or Pew Research Center.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Given that China peaks its carbon emissions and a WHO-identified harmful chemical is banned, will a philosophical debate on nuclear technology be held internationally by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following occurs by January 1, 2028: (a) China peaks its carbon dioxide emissions before 2030, confirmed by official data from the Ministry of Ecology and Environment of the People's Republic of China or another authorized governmental body, and (b) any country passes legislation banning the use of a specific chemical substance identified as harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO), with the legislation officially enacted and published in the country's official legal records.

Given this, will a philosophical debate on nuclear technology and risks be held at an international forum before January 1, 2028? The debate must be officially documented and reported by a reputable news source or the organizing body.

para_P.title: If China reaches its peak carbon emissions and a harmful chemical recognized by the WHO is prohibited, will there be an international philosophical discussion on nuclear technology by 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following takes place by January 1, 2028: (a) China achieves its maximum carbon dioxide emissions prior to 2030, as verified by official reports from the Ministry of Ecology and Environment of the People's Republic of China or another authorized governmental entity, and (b) any nation enacts laws banning the use of a specific chemical deemed harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO), with the legislation formally enacted and recorded in the nation's official legal documents.

Under these conditions, will there be a philosophical discussion regarding nuclear technology and its associated risks at an international forum before January 1, 2028? This discussion must be officially recorded and reported by a credible news organization or the organizing body.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by January 1, 2028: (a) China peaks its carbon dioxide emissions before 2030, (b) any country passes legislation banning a WHO-identified harmful chemical, and (c) a philosophical debate on nuclear technology and risks is held at an international forum?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if all of the following conditions are met between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (a) China meets its target to peak carbon dioxide emissions before 2030, confirmed by official data from the Ministry of Ecology and Environment of the People's Republic of China or another authorized governmental body, (b) any country passes legislation banning the use of a specific chemical substance identified as harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO), with the legislation officially enacted and published in the country's official legal records, and (c) a philosophical debate on nuclear technology and risks is held at an international forum, officially documented and reported by a reputable news source or the organizing body.

para_P.title: Is it guaranteed that the following will take place by January 1, 2028: (a) China will reach its peak carbon dioxide emissions before 2030, (b) any nation will implement laws prohibiting a chemical recognized as harmful by the WHO, and (c) an international forum will host a philosophical discussion regarding nuclear technology and its associated risks?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed 'Yes' if all of the following criteria are satisfied between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028: (a) China achieves its goal of peaking carbon dioxide emissions prior to 2030, as verified by official statistics from the Ministry of Ecology and Environment of the People's Republic of China or another authorized governmental entity, (b) any nation enacts legislation that bans the use of a specific chemical deemed harmful by the World Health Organization (WHO), with the law officially enacted and recorded in the nation's official legal documents, and (c) an international forum conducts a philosophical discussion on nuclear technology and its risks, which is officially documented and reported by a credible news outlet or the organizing body.

question.title: Will a machine learning algorithm be used to fully automate the tax filing process in France before January 1, 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if, between October 1, 2024 and January 1, 2028, a machine learning algorithm is officially used to fully automate the tax filing process in France. The implementation must be confirmed by an official announcement from the French government and reported by major news outlets.

para_P.title: Will a machine learning system be employed to completely automate the tax submission procedure in France prior to January 1, 2028?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with 'Yes' if, during the period from October 1, 2024 to January 1, 2028, a machine learning system is officially utilized to entirely automate the tax submission procedure in France. The deployment must be validated by an official declaration from the French government and covered by prominent news organizations.

question.title: Given France fully automates tax filing with AI, will any country grant robots human rights by 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, a machine learning algorithm is officially used to fully automate the tax filing process in France, confirmed by an official announcement from the French government and reported by major news outlets. 

Then, will any country officially implement a national policy granting robots the same legal rights as humans at any point between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028? The policy must be officially recognized and enacted by the country's government.

para_P.title: If France completely automates tax submissions using AI, will any nation provide robots with human rights by 2028?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: From October 1, 2024, until January 1, 2028, a machine learning system is officially adopted to entirely automate the tax submission process in France, as confirmed by an official declaration from the French government and covered by leading news organizations. 

Then, will any nation officially establish a national policy that grants robots the same legal rights as human beings at any time during the period from October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028? This policy must be formally acknowledged and implemented by the government of the respective country.

question.title: Conditional on both France automating tax filing with AI and any country granting robots human rights by 2028, will the US Congress pass a federal budget with a deficit exceeding $2 trillion for any fiscal year before 2028?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before January 1, 2028, (1) a machine learning algorithm is officially used to fully automate the tax filing process in France, as confirmed by the French government and major news outlets, and (2) any country officially implements a national policy granting robots the same legal rights as humans.

Given these conditions, will the US Congress pass a federal budget with a deficit exceeding $2 trillion for any fiscal year before January 1, 2028? This will be resolved as 'Yes' if the deficit exceeds $2 trillion for any fiscal year between now and January 1, 2028, based on official data from the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) or the Office of Management and Budget (OMB).

para_P.title: Assuming that France has fully implemented AI for automating tax filing and that any nation has conferred human rights upon robots by 2028, will the United States Congress authorize a federal budget that runs a deficit greater than $2 trillion for any fiscal year prior to 2028?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario: Before the start of 2028, (1) the French government and leading news organizations confirm that a machine learning system is being employed to completely automate tax filing in France, and (2) any nation adopts a formal policy that grants robots the same legal rights as human beings.

Under these circumstances, will the United States Congress approve a federal budget that results in a deficit surpassing $2 trillion for any fiscal year leading up to January 1, 2028? This will be deemed 'Yes' if the deficit exceeds $2 trillion for any fiscal year from now until January 1, 2028, according to official reports from the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) or the Office of Management and Budget (OMB).

para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered 'Yes' if all of the subsequent criteria are satisfied: (1) From October 1, 2024, to January 1, 2028, a machine learning algorithm is officially utilized to completely automate the tax filing process in France, as confirmed by an official declaration from the French government and reported by leading news organizations. (2) Between October 1, 2024, and January 1, 2028, any country officially enacts a national policy that accords robots the same legal rights as human beings, acknowledged and implemented by the respective government. (3) The US Congress passes a federal budget with a deficit surpassing $2 trillion for any fiscal year from the date this question was created until January 1, 2028, based on official data from the Congressional Budget Office (CBO) or the Office of Management and Budget (OMB).

question.title: Will renewable energy sources account for at least 50% of the United States' total energy production by January 1, 2028?

question.title: Will the European Union's GDP growth rate exceed 4% for any calendar year between 2024 and 2028?
question.body: This question will be resolved as 'Yes' if the GDP growth rate of the European Union, as reported by the World Bank or the International Monetary Fund (IMF), exceeds 4% for any calendar year between 2024 and 2028. The growth rate must be based on official annual GDP growth data.

para_P.title: Is it possible for the GDP growth rate of the European Union to surpass 4% in any year from 2024 to 2028?
